usefulItems: 900 g loaf tin (2 lb), skewer, wire rack, oven
title: Christmas Gingerbread (Poland)

ingredients.content: 80 g butter, soft, plus extra for greasing
250 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
1 ½ - 2 tsp gingerbread seasoning, to taste (see tip)
80 g dark chocolate, 70% cocoa, small pieces or callets

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 170°C. Grease a loaf tin (length 28 cm or 2 lb) with butter and sprinkle with flour.
Place butter, honey and gingerbread seasoning in mixing bowl then heat <b>3 min/50°C/speed 0.5<b>.
Add eggs, bicarbonate of soda and flour then mix <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>.
Strain cherries through simmering basket then gently squeeze.

Transfer half of dough to prepared tin, place reserved cherries on top, then cover with remaining dough. Bake for 50-55 minutes (170°C) until golden brown and a skewer inserted in middle comes out clean. Meanwhile, clean and dry mixing bowl. Leave gingerbread to cool completely in tin on a wire rack then remove.
Place chocolate in mixing bowl and grate <b>5 sec/speed 8<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and heat <b>3 min/50°C/speed 3<b>. Pour over cooled cake.
When icing is set, serve cut in slices.

hintsAndTricks: Gingerbread spice can be made in your Thermomix: In a clean and dry mixing bowl, place 4 cinnamon sticks, 2 tsp ground ginger, 5 g nutmeg, 10 allspice berries, 10 g cloves, 25 cardamom seeds (shelled), 1 star anise, and 20 black peppercorns then grind 1 min 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. If necessary, grind again 30 sec/speed 10. Store in a sealed container.
